text.__SUMMARY__: Conus allaryi is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails and their allies.Like all species within the genus Conus, these snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
text.Description: The size of the shell varies between 23 mm and 26 mm.
text.Distribution: This species occurs in the Atlantic Ocean off Angola.
text.References:
Bozzetti, L. 2008b. Conus allaryi (Gastropoda; Prosobranchia: Conidae) a new species from Angola. Malacologia Mostra Mondiale 61:12-13
Puillandre N., Duda T.F., Meyer C., Olivera B.M. & Bouchet P. (2015). One, four or 100 genera? A new classification of the cone snails. Journal of Molluscan Studies. 81: 1-23
